title: Add Google Play Store publishing guidance and assets for the truck game

requirements.text: Add a new "Publish on Google Play" help section (English) on the Start screen that explains that the current game is a web/PWA app, and outlines the high-level steps to publish it to the Google Play Store (e.g., wrap the PWA as an Android app using Trusted Web Activity, create an AAB, upload to Play Console).
acceptanceCriteria: Start screen shows an additional help section titled "Publish on Google Play" in English.
The text clearly distinguishes: (1) installing via browser as a PWA vs (2) publishing to Play Store.

The help section includes a concise step list that mentions generating an Android App Bundle (AAB) and using a Trusted Web Activity wrapper, without requiring users to understand internal code details.
No existing gameplay UI (Play button, how-to-play instructions) is removed or broken on mobile.

requirements.text: Add a repository documentation file that provides a practical, step-by-step checklist for publishing this PWA to the Google Play Store, including: required Play Console items (app listing, screenshots, feature graphic), generating Android wrapper (TWA), creating/signing AAB, Digital Asset Links (assetlinks.json) hosting expectations, testing, and common troubleshooting for release/publishing.
acceptanceCriteria: A new documentation file exists in the repo (e.g., docs/PLAY_STORE_PUBLISHING.md) written in English.
The doc includes a checklist of required store assets (icon, feature graphic, screenshots) and where to place them in the repo.
The doc includes guidance on selecting a valid app identifier/domain naming format (5â€“50 chars, letters/numbers/hyphens only) to avoid validation errors.
The doc includes at least one troubleshooting section addressing failed build/publish attempts (e.g., missing manifest, missing icons, invalid identifiers).

requirements.text: Ensure the app has the required PWA metadata suitable for packaging/publishing: confirm a web app manifest is present and linked from the HTML entrypoint, includes correct name/short_name, start_url, display, theme/background colors, and includes required icon sizes. If any of these are missing, add/update them and make sure the app still runs normally in the browser.
acceptanceCriteria: The HTML entrypoint (frontend/index.html) links a web app manifest via <link rel="manifest" ...> (if not already present).
A web app manifest exists in the frontend public assets and includes at minimum: name, short_name, start_url, display, background_color, theme_color, and icons including 192x192 and 512x512 PNGs.
The game still loads and plays correctly in a mobile browser after the manifest/icon changes.
No changes are required in the Motoko backend for these updates.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/immutablePaths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; no additional backend services.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Actually publishing the app to the Google Play Console from within this codebase (Play Console access and compliance steps are external).
Implementing native Android-specific gameplay features (e.g., push notifications, GPS, platform APIs).
Adding third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity.

required: App icon in a bold, simple flat style: a front-facing cartoon truck emblem on a clean background (app-icon.dim_512x512.png)
App icon small version optimized for readability at small sizes (app-icon-small.dim_192x192.png)
Google Play feature graphic banner: dynamic road + truck scene, minimal text-free composition (play-feature-graphic.dim_1024x500.png)
Android phone screenshot-style promotional image: gameplay with HUD visible, portrait layout (play-screenshot-1.dim_1080x1920.png)
Android phone screenshot-style promotional image: Start screen visible, portrait layout (play-screenshot-2.dim_1080x1920.png)
